intro: Aeridostachya sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, adapting to waterlogged soils with its extensive root system. Its small, two-lipped flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces lightweight seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
